page.title: 06Farms 2
page.content:
SOUTH MOSSES: South Mosses is built of stone and is about two hundred years old. It is an arable farm. They grow some crops, barley,potatoes and turnips but these are just for their own use to feed the animals. There are 600 acres of land altogether and lots of machinery; baler, several tractors, forage harvester, silage trailer and muck spreaders.
Summary:- The other farms in the area are very similar. Some have public water supply and one has its own spring well. The type of farming is much the same on all the farms; mainly cattle and sheep with few crops. The buildings are made of stone and some are over 300 years old. Extensions or outbuildings have been completed in concrete blocks.
